data.title: Is 'About My Father' in the 'Meet the Parents' film series?
data.meta_description:
The French titles for the Meet the Parents film series are:

Mon beau-père et moi (Meet the Parents). IMDb.
Mon beau-père, mes parents et moi (Meet the Fockers). IMDb.
Mon beau-père et nous (Little
data.text:
No, it's not in the Meet the Parents film series. As per Wikipedia, it is

loosely based on [actor Sebastian Maniscalco]'s life and his relationship with his father, played by Robert De Niro.

The only similarities, as you've noted, are the French title and the presence of De Niro as a father figure.

To explain why this may be the case, there is a known phenomenon - especially with comedy movies - which TV Tropes calls Translation Matchmaking, in which a film is renamed for a specific market in order to suggest a non-existent connection with a previous film. Airplane was extremely prone to this, with subsequent films starring Leslie Nielsen or created by ZAZ often being retitled in foreign countries to make the Airplane connection obvious.

I cannot prove it, but my suspicion is that About My Father's French title is an example of this phenomenon, and was chosen to imply a connection with De Niro's earlier film that isn't actually there.
